command: [withheld] PowerShell launching wscript.exe to run PubPrn.vbs with irregular parameters leading to an unexpected child process (details redacted).
explanation: Uses the signed PubPrn.vbs via wscript.exe as a proxy to execute another binary/script, leveraging trust in the signed script host and script to slip past controls.
rationale_steps: powershell.exe is the parent of wscript.exe, which is uncommon in normal administrative workflows.
wscript.exe executes PubPrn.vbs from a system directory with parameters inconsistent with standard printer tasks.
Process lineage shows wscript.exe spawning a second-stage process unrelated to printing operations.
Command line includes suspicious tokens or paths (e.g., UNC, HTTP/S) suggestive of proxy execution.
Correlate with absence of corresponding printer configuration changes in system logs.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No concrete command string is provided and key parameters are redacted, so it cannot be verified as well-formed or runnable.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Leveraging wscript.exe to run the signed PubPrn.vbs as a proxy to spawn another process aligns with T1216 on Windows, though missing exact arguments and paths reduce certainty.
